intro: Stackhousia intermedia f. genuina, commonly known as the narrow-leaved stackhousia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it contributes to local biodiversity. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it requires specific growing conditions to flourish.
